ia.dna

Class NeuralNet

  • java.lang.Object
    • ia.dna.NeuralNet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DNA

    public class NeuralNet
extends java.lang.Object
implements DNA
    DNA Implementation for the Neural Network. Also contains generic propagation (feedforward algorithm) and some constructors. DOES NOT cover biaises
    Author:
    louis

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description

      Initializes a neuralnet based on an array of Matrices.
      NeuralNet(NeuralNet nn)
      This constructor copies the shape of the NN given as input (shape is the set {layers, minweight, maxweight}).

    • Constructor Detail

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet()
        Default initializer based on experience of best results

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(int nbInput,
                 int nbOutput,
                 int[] hidden,
                 double minWeight,
                 double maxWeight)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Initializer for every field in this class. The weihts initialization is done in method randomInitWeights
        Parameters:
        nbInput - to initialize the field of the same name
        nbOutput - to initialize the field of the same name
        hidden - to initialize the field of the same name
        minWeight - to initialize the field of the same name
        maxWeight - to initialize the field of the same name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - in case minw >= maxw, or the number of input/output/hidden is 0

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(Jama.Matrix[] w)
        Initializes a neuralnet based on an array of Matrices. Hence the mimnw and maxw values are pointless
        Parameters:
        w - the array of matrices to use as weights

      • NeuralNet

        public NeuralNet(NeuralNet nn)
        This constructor copies the shape of the NN given as input (shape is the set {layers, minweight, maxweight}). RandomInit is called to initialize the weights matrices
        Parameters:
        nn - the NeuralNet whose shape we want to copy

        private void randomInitWeights()

      • randomMatrix

        public Jama.Matrix randomMatrix(int nrow,
                                int ncol)
        Initializes a single Matrix using the Jama.Matrix.random method
        Parameters:
        nrow - te number of rows of the matrix
        ncol - the number of columns of the matrix
        Returns:
        the randomly generated matrix

      • propagation

        public Jama.Matrix propagation(Jama.Matrix input)
                        throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Propagation (feedforward) algorithm. Applies the equations (z=wa+b) and (a= activation(z)) for every layer (here b=0 : not taken into account)
        Parameters:
        input - the input vector to apply the algorithm on
        Returns:
        the output vector of this network based on the input
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the input is incorrect

      • activationFunction

        public static void activationFunction(Jama.Matrix m)
        Applies the activation function elementwise on the matrix, using the matrix' setters (hence void). This will probabbly only be used on vectors, ie. (n,1) matrices.
        Parameters:
        m - the matrix to apply the actiation function on.

      • sig

        public static double sig(double x)
        One possible actiavtion function : the generic sigmoid
        Parameters:
        x - the input to apply the function on
        Returns:
        the output, hence sigma(x)

      • reLU

        public static double reLU(double x)
        One possible actiavtion function : the Rectified Linear Unit
        Parameters:
        x - the input to apply the function on
        Returns:
        the output, hence max(0,x)

      • print

        public void print()
        Debugging function to print all the neuralnet's weights

      • add

        public NeuralNet add(NeuralNet nn)
        Deprecated. 
        Addition of a neuralnet's weights with another (for mutations). Never used in practice
        Parameters:
        nn - the neural net to add the weights to
        Returns:
        the new neural net

      • randomNNShape

        public static NeuralNet randomNNShape(NeuralNet nn,
                                      double mutAmpl)
        Deprecated. 
        Never used in practice. Method to generate a neuralnet based on another's architecture
        Parameters:
        nn - the neuralnet to copy architecture
        mutAmpl - the amplitude of mutations, to generate weights
        Returns:
        the new neuralnet

      • decidejump

        public boolean decidejump(Obstacle obstacle,
                          Whale whale)
        Description copied from interface: DNA
        Asks the DNA model whether to jump, based on the obstacle and the bird it controls
        Specified by:
        decidejump in interface DNA
        Parameters:
        obstacle - the obstacle to dodge
        whale - the bird associated with the DNA implementation
        Returns:
        a boolean = (if bird should jump)

      • mutate

        public void mutate(double mutAmpl,
                   double mutProba)
        Description copied from interface: DNA
        Tweaks the DNA implementation as a mutation. Never used in practice : usually nested in crossover; some specific Selection methods might require this.
        Specified by:
        mutate in interface DNA
        Parameters:
        mutAmpl - the amplitude of the mutations to apply
        mutProba - the probability for a mutation to happen

      • crossover

        public DNA crossover(DNA otherNN,
                     double mutAmpl,
                     double mutProba)
        Description copied from interface: DNA
        Merges two sets of DNA with some mutations to create an offspring
        Specified by:
        crossover in interface DNA
        Parameters:
        otherNN - the DNA of the other parent, to merge with this instance of DNA.
        Returns:
        the offspring as product of the breeding of the two DNAs
